newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.AFRICAN WATER CONTROL BILL DELAYED.
newsitem.headline: S.AFRICAN WATER CONTROL BILL DELAYED.

text.p: Water Affairs and Forestry Minister Kader Asmal has decided not to table his controversial new bill aimed at regulating the use of the nation's scarce water resources this year.
He said in a statement on Tuesday that he had decided to postpone the tabling of the bill until early next year to allow more time for consultation with interested parties.

He said he had hoped to table the bill this year but due to requests from interested parties and "the enormous complexity of the task that we are involved in," he had decided to extend consultation by a further six months.
The proposed bill has drawn fire particularly from farmers who objected to the fact that Asmal appeared to want to regulate their use of all water, including rain water.
